long_desc.thetext:
A Heap Buffer Overflow issue in imagemagick, which has been fixed here:
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/9a9896fce95d09e5e47b86baccbe1ce1a2fca76b

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2208544]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2208543]

A Heap Buffer Overflow issue in imagemagick, which has been fixed here:
https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/9a9896fce95d09e5e47b86baccbe1ce1a2fca76b

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 2208544]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 2208543]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2208537

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

bugs.title: CVE-2023-34474 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer overflow in ReadTIM2ImageData() function in coders/tim2.c

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-34474 ImageMagick: heap-based buffer overflow in ReadTIM2ImageData() function in coders/tim2.c

long_desc.thetext:
A heap-based buffer overflow issue was discovered in ImageMagick's ReadTIM2ImageData() function in coders/tim2.c. An attacker could pass specially crafted file to convert, triggering an out-of-bounds read error, allowing an application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/1061db7f80fdc9ef572ac60b55f408f7bab6e1b0

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2214156]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2214154]
Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2214157]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-34475 ImageMagick: heap use-after-free issue in ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c.

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-34475 ImageMagick: heap use-after-free issue in ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c.

long_desc.thetext:
A heap use after free issue was discovered in ImageMagick's ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c. An attacker could pass specially crafted file to convert, triggering an heap-use-after-free write error, allowing an application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/1061db7f80fdc9ef572ac60b55f408f7bab6e1b0

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2214158]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2214155]
Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2214159]

bugs.title: CVE-2023-34475 ImageMagick: heap use-after-free issue in ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c. [epel-8]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2023-34475 ImageMagick: heap use-after-free issue in ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c. [epel-8]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2023-34475 ImageMagick: heap use-after-free issue in ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c.

long_desc.thetext:
A heap use after free issue was discovered in ImageMagick's ReplaceXmpValue() function in MagickCore/profile.c. An attacker could pass specially crafted file to convert, triggering an heap-use-after-free write error, allowing an application to crash, resulting in a denial of service.

https://github.com/ImageMagick/ImageMagick/commit/1061db7f80fdc9ef572ac60b55f408f7bab6e1b0

Created ImageMagick tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-8 [bug 2214158]
Affects: fedora-37 [bug 2214155]
Affects: fedora-38 [bug 2214159]

More information about this security flaw is available in the following bug:

http://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2214149

Disclaimer: Community trackers are created by Red Hat Product Security team on a best effort basis. Package maintainers are required to ascertain if the flaw indeed affects their package, before starting the update process.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
